DOC.brief_summary: Long-term , observational , prospective , multicenter registry follow patient implanted SUPERA Interwoven Self-Expanding Nitinol Stent treat stenosis superficial femoral and/or femoropopliteal artery .
DOC.brief_title: Data Registry Following Patients Using Supera Stent Femoral Arteries
DOC.detailed_description: This registry follow 200 patient least 5 year . The STRONG Data Registry follow patient real world condition , evaluate restenosis rate , periprocedural/postprocedural complication , patency , target lesion revascularization , walk distance , stent fracture , adverse events/serious adverse event .
DOC.criteria: ( Clinical ) Patient legal guardian understands registry procedure voluntarily sign informed consent accordance institutional local regulatory policy . ( Note : Retrospective data may collect enter EDC system fully execute informed consent provide ) . RutherfordBecker classification 2 5 Patient least 18 year age legal age consent . Patient must willing participate registry least 5 year . ( Angiographic ) Target lesion single de novo restenotic ( outside stent ) SFA Popliteal artery lesion ≥ 1 cm origin another stent ; additional lesion may present. , one target lesion All SFA target lesion locate proximal point least 2 cm origin profunda femoris artery . All Popliteal Artery target lesion locate distal point least 1 cm proximal bifurcation anterior tibial artery tibioperoneal trunk . Target lesion length 120 cm ( visual estimate ) Target lesion stenosis ≥50 % ( visual estimate ) Popliteal artery patent lesion SFA SFA patent lesion popliteal artery At least one widely patent ( < 50 % stenosis ) infrapopliteal artery ( distal runoff ) ( Clinical ) Evidence heparin induce thrombocytopenia ( HIT ) , intravenous tPA , Plavix , Ticlid , aspirin therapy sensitivity Patient participate clinical study could confound result Patient pregnant/breastfeeding time enrollment plan become pregnant course participation registry . ( Angiographic ) Target lesion length > 20 cm Instent restenotic / reoccluded target lesion Acute ( ≤ 4 week ) thrombotic occlusion Untreated ipsilateral pelvic stenosis
